instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Got a bit of a odd one. <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Press power and I hear the chime and the screen change shades of black. (with room light off it's the backlight) I shine a light through the back and nothing on screen no logo or anything. OK I shut it down and hooked an external monitor to it then started up again and screen is normal image but nothing on external monitor. I can unhook monitor and the screen stays on just fine BUT reboot and no video again. I can repeat the process to get the screen on but what would cause this?????
Forgot to mention that I checked both sides of board for corrosion and anything out of the normal and was the cleanest board I ever seen, looked brand new no signs of anything. Also tried a PRAM and SMC reset and did nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal level.
Be sure to use original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Original Magsafe 2 charger?
Did you check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal when internal LCD doesn't have image?
Also check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> at same time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Yes, used charger and on battery. And yes checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> with laptop running with No mage. I will need to check <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> and report back. Thank you for the help.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: OK, 2.45v at <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> but I went and checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> right after and 0v now, then suddenly comes back to 3.4v but still nothing on screen. Checked this a few times now and same result.  (Head scratcher)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
There should be some history fault, even no liquid sign visible.
What said the client?

Post voltage at pins 3/4 and 18/19 of J8300, when there is no image.
Did you try another LCD assembly?
Even cracked, just for test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Bought through Auction so doing for myself. No other screen to test with. 3/4= 24.5v and 18/19= 3.28v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Not going to toss a screen when I seen it working just fine. Makes no sense. Is there a chip that controls when to switch between external screen and onboard screen? Also did you see when I said at one time I got zero volts at <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>? Other than the screen what is your best guess?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 0V, image and backlight both are disabled.
But you said the problem appears even with correct <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
Check for internal video only with MLB and LCD connected; unplug LIO flex, TP, airport and SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Please be patient with me as I'm a bit new at this stuff and almost all my repairs have been water damage or rework from other shops. 
I have the wireless card out and the SSD out and the flex cable that goes over the fan off but not sure on what the TP is? With those 3 things off I have backlight but no video again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
TP=TrackPad.

So now you get backlight without image on internal LCD?
This is really strange; please check for image with a  flashlight.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Oh ok, I knew it wasn't toilet paper LOL. I always did get a backlight and no image. Sorry if my first post was not clear.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
I still recommend to try another LCD assembly.
Looks like communication problem between PCH and LCD.
If backlight is on, PCH recognizes LCD, but something goes wrong on eDP bus...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message: Well 2informaticoc I guess you are correct! I got in another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in this week and did a quick swap of the logic boards and screen still did not have an image unless I put on an external monitor. I put the guts in the other one and screen worked as it should. Really weird to me how that works. So any good forums to buy used Mac parts??? LOL

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
You can get good parts on Aliexpress.
Look customers reviews when you search for products...
